intro: Hibbertia auriculiflora, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy surface, and the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Hibbertia auriculiflora is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
